summary:
I am a project leader and senior expert drought and groundwater at the department of Soil and Groundwater Systems of the applied knowledge Institute Deltares. In addition, I coordinate the Deltares wide research programs about drought and information systems for water security. My research interests are primarily related to droughts, water scarcity issues, and sustainable groundwater management (both operational and strategic), as well as integrated risk assessments. In addition, I am experienced with risk assessments of mining activities on the shallow subsurface, water reserves, and the human environment. Previously, I did a PhD on greenhouse gas emissions from peat areas related to changes in climate and land- and water management.
In my work I integrate big data sources with local measurements/knowledge and scientific expertise. Presenting complex information in an understandable way, for instance in conceptual models or dashboard tools. "Simplifying without compromising on the results."
